programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Matt and Vicky Wade ask Casas Manuel to find them a holiday home with plenty of outside space for sunbathing, while Sharon shows her sister's friend three apartments in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Newly retired Sue Garbutt from Devon seeks a property in the Alicante area. Meanwhile, 150 miles south, Neil Street-Bailey looks to swap the rat race for a Spanish residence.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: In Ashurst Wood, West Sussex, the property expert helps to modernise a cluttered 1950s home so retired couple Tim and Gina can take the unusual step of upsizing. In Weybridge, Surrey, he visits a not-so-Swinging Sixties pad inherited by siblings Nigel and Beverley, who need to bring their property up to scratch before potential buyers arrive.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples host dinner parties in Bedfordshire, with Gavin and Jodie, Francis and Yvonne, and Lisa and Ed all competing for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Edinburgh lovebirds Andy and Pim hope to impress guests Jimmy and Jas and Stuart and Jack, with a Scottish and Thai-themed menu, with a bit of American thrown in for good measure.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah & Mason's, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. Members of staff complain their pay cheques bounce, and the kitchen cooler is so unhygienic that Gordon makes the decision to close the restaurant on Valentine's Day - the busiest night of the year.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Newly married couple Ed and Clare are planning to start a family soon and will need a larger home. Ed wants to raise his family where he grew up in Lunigiana, Italy, so Jonnie Irwin finds some rural properties within their £250,000 budget. However, Clare wants to remain close to her relatives, so asks Laura Hamilton to find them suitable properties in the Sevenoaks area of Kent.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: The final episode of the series focuses on the most outspoken heir to the throne, Prince Charles, and the radically different vision of the monarchy he promised for his own reign. From a young age, Charles was determined to do something important with his position in the royal family, doing so as he set up the Prince's Trust charity to help unfashionable causes, and also weighed in on controversial political issues across the years.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary examining an espionage operation conducted to gather information on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. Shown to mark the 80th anniversary of the king's abdication, the programmes examines recently declassified documents revealing the extent of the surveillance and who ordered it, as well as featuring dramatic reconstructions and eyewitness accounts.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: Abel Morrison has three wives and 11 children, and his newest wife, Marina, is heavily pregnant, so it's a chaotic time for the family. However, while his first wife Suzie takes the challenges of plural marriage in her stride, his second wife Beth is struggling with Marina's demands on their husband's attention - and things come to a head on the day of the birth.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring Line of Duty, University Challenge, Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad, Comic Relief, Broadchurch, One Night with my Ex, All Round to Mrs Brown's and the News.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The eagle-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Elderly one-eyed South African porcupine Roxy is introduced to a new, younger male called Henning, in the hope that she will find companionship in her old age. Kifaru, the oldest eastern black rhino at Chester Zoo, meets younger female Malindi, with the expectation that they will produce offspring to increase the dwindling population, while the Caribbean flamingos are breeding again.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: Homeland
programme.desc: Dar plays his hand and Quinn revisits his past. Thriller following a team of CIA agents battling terrorists and problems in their personal lives. Claire Danes stars.(n)

programme.title: First Contact: Lost Tribe of the Amazon
programme.desc: In June 2014, the world was transfixed by images of men emerging from the deepest Amazon rainforest for the first time. They were among the last people living on our planet who had had no contact with the outside world. In this documentary, film-maker Angus Macqueen gains access to this tribe, to Xani and Shirimaku and their families, to find out how they lived, why they had remained isolated for so long and what finally brought them out of isolation.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller deals with an early morning emergency before heading to Wales to try out life as a country vet, wrestling a feisty ram and helping save a foal with a hernia.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple who live in Australia are given help looking for a property as they look to spend half of the year in Spain, while a woman is aiming to find a holiday home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: David and Pam Rowe are searching for their dream retirement home, so Spanish Property Choice line three apartments up for them to see within their 110,000 euro budget.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Warrington, where he meets Pauline and Alan Jacks, who have been trying to sell their three-bedroom property. He soon realises potential buyers may have been deterred by the dated decor, cuddly toys, tapestries and dolls dotted around the place. A few miles away, Colin Brunold has been hoping his four-bedroom family home would sell itself, but a dodgy chimney could be putting off house-hunters.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amateur dramatics enthusiasts Ryan and Kitty kick off proceedings in Liverpool, followed by hairdresser Karen and builder Alun, and Birkenhead couple Tony and Debby.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lee and fiancee Nicky begin the competition in Bristol with an Italian-themed menu, followed by Libby and Graham, who have been married for 54 years, and lively couple Nico and Sky.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a mother-and-son team who have gone through 20 chefs in two years at their struggling Italian restaurant in California. The adjoining bar is a triumph, but the oldest dining establishment in town needs an overhaul if the inexperienced owners are to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: The property experts help new grandparents Geoff and Barbara Harrison choose a second home to enjoy with their growing family in Devon or in Languedoc, France.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the countryside surrounding Edinburgh helping Ian find a new home - but it soon becomes clear that he is more interested in finding the right shed for his collection of cars and tools than somewhere to lay his head. Phil Spencer is with Rogan and Jane, who suffer from chronic indecision when it comes to house hunting - and that's the least thing they need as they have to find a home fast before their first baby arrives in three months' time.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr returns with the hybrid panel quiz show, putting a comedy spin on Channel 4's long-running words-and-numbers game. This time, guest team captain David Walliams joins forces with Jonathan Ross, while Jon Richardson teams up with Joe Lycett. Isy Suttie joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley takes care of the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In the north-east of England, former pub landlord Rob McKenzie has found his own way of dealing with tenants who abandon properties and leave behind destruction and unpaid rent, while agent Caroline is new to the job and finds herself being drawn into tensions on a street in Hartlepool.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan hears more inspirational stories of how some of the richest people in the UK and from around the world made their fortunes, discovering tales of hard graft, bizarre businesses and plucky entrepreneurship. the latest edition, the Canadian comedian meets a 22-year-old millionaire poker player, goes on a house hunt with former Big Brother contestant Aisleyne Horgan-Wallace, who is now a property mogul, and hangs out with a billionaire interior designer who has many celebrity clients.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Expensive Food
programme.desc: The conclusion of the documentary following the companies who cater to Britain's super-rich clients examines how competition for the attention of the mega-wealthy is driving innovation. Suppliers must deliver more than just food as their customers have already eaten in all the best restaurants, meaning it's the exclusivity of the dining experience that counts and the story behind the ingredients that matters.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul Bohill and Steve and Ben Pinner face their biggest eviction yet - taking on squatters in a large central London office block. With the help of the police, they try to remove a suspected group of 70 from the building, but with a barricade in place, the team faces a challenging operation ahead. Elsewhere, officers are confronted by an army of family and friends when they attempt to enforce a writ at the property of a debtor, and face a difficult eviction at the north London home of a heavily pregnant tenant and her family, after the council fails to pay the rent to the landlord.(n)

Fact-based crime drama, with Nicolas Cage, John Cusack and Vanessa Hudgens.(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965, and the soldiers who were involved, are depicted in this drama(n)

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: Crazy comedy by Joel and Ethan Coen starring Nicolas Cage and Holly Hunter as a couple who, unable to have children of their own, kidnap one of tycoon Trey Wilson's quintuplets and become caught up in a zany spiral of crime and farce(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: Retired male stripper Magic Mike decides to help his friends put on one last show, as the crew embark on a road trip to Myrtle Beach to perform at an exotic-dance convention. Along the way, they brighten the lives of several women in this sexy sequel(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Though chef Kate Armstrong's Type A personality serves her well when whipping up meals in the trendy Manhattan eatery where she has made a name for herself, it threatens to sink her when she is named as the guardian of her nine-year-old niece Zoe. To complicate matters, an impetuous new sous chef named Nick Palmer has recently joined the kitchen staff and his freewheeling personality seems to stand in direct opposition to Kate's unwavering perfectionism. Irish Televsion Premiere (S)(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: Edie Falco and Angela Basset head the outstanding ensemble cast in this keenly drawn character study. Set in a northern Florida coastal town, it's the tale of an engaging collection of locals and their reactions to the arrival of real-estate developers who want a piece of their paradise.Timothy Hutton, Bill Cobbs. Written and directed by John Sayles(n)

programme.title: Remember the Titans
programme.desc: The appointment of black coach Herman Boone to a high school in 70s Virginia causes a stir in the town, where white coach Yoast is well-respected. Boone walks into a minefield of bigotry but his fair-minded approach gradually wins the hearts of his players. A tub-thumping, passionate tale based on a true story(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: The Barden Bellas are back, determined to enter (and win) an international competition - one that has never had an American winner. After a disasterous performance elsewhere, the Bellas have much more to prove if they want to become the best!(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Touching, tragic romantic drama with Keanu Reeves and Charlize Theron who fall in love with only a short amount of time to spend together(n)

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: Action. When a young warrior in sixteenth-century Scotland fails to die from a fatal wound, he is banished from his clan, but later learns that he is part of an immortal race. Centuries later in New York he must fight his ultimate enemy to become the last of his kind(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: (1987) Oliver Stone's morality tale stars Charlie Sheen as Bud Fox, an ambitious young stockbroker, who's willing to do whatever it takes to emulate his hero, supremely wealthy financier Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas). Bud's initial attempts to play the market honestly don't light his touchpaper to success. But, when he passes on some insider information to Gekko, his career starts to pick up pace and, as he becomes increasingly embroiled in illegal trading and financial espionage, he begins to make the money of his dreams. However, he fails to fully comprehend the true cost of his deals until one of them threatens the livelihood of his union boss father (Martin Sheen). Also starring Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp. M,W,R(n)

Starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.desc: The murder of a port authority officer reveals Parsa's possible whereabouts as the team continues the hunt for the terrorist intent on wiping out NCIS. programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.desc: Fact-based tarring Julia Roberts and Albert Finney about an unsophisticated single mother who stumbles upon an environmental cover-up which eventually leads to a class action lawsuit. While working for a lawyer, she is puzzled by an old case and decides to do some research of her own. She discovers that a chemical company knowingly polluted the local area, and with the help of the lawyer launches a class action to sue the company for damages(n)

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: This touching saga follows the remarkable life of a simple, innocent man who finds himself in extraordinary, history-making situations. It features amazing special effects. The film chronicles his life from the '50s up through the '80s and is narrated by Gump. As a boy in Greenbow Alabama, the mildly retarded (a 75 IQ) and slightly crippled Forrest was the butt of childhood cruelty. His only friend was Jenny, a sexually abused child, who became the love of his life. During those thirty years Gump becomes a football star, meets George Wallace and JFK, wins the congressional medal of honor in Vietnam, meets LBJ, spends the night with the Black Panthers, becomes an international ping-pong champion, plays a role in Watergate, develops a multi-million dollar shrimp empire with a buddy, and becomes a jogging guru as he runs across the country several times. His love Jenny is on a different and self-destructive road that leads her to become a stripper, a hippy, a radical and finally a single mother. Gump always loved her unconditionally and in the end provides her with the peace she always sought(n)

programme.desc: Two LAPD detectives must set aside their differences when they're assigned to track down a serial killer the press has dubbed The Family Man(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: The third film in the Dirty Harry series sees maverick cop Harry Callahan dealing with an underground terrorist group in his inimitable fashion. The People's Revolutionary Strike Force steal a truckload of weapons from an arms storehouse and threaten to blow the city to smithereens unless their demands are met. Harry is put on the case but seems to be more concerned by the fact that his new partner is a woman(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: The Wrestler
programme.desc: Mickey Rourke is a fading pro-wrestler struggling to adjust to life outside the ring in this Oscar-winning 2008 movie. Marisa Tomei co-stars(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Writer/director Victor Salva returns to his horror roots with this teen-slasher genre flick, one of several 2001 films produced by Francis Ford Coppola's American Zoetrope studio. Gina Philips and Justin Long are siblings Trish and Darry, road tripping home from college across the U.S. and bickering all the way. Menaced by a truck on the highway, the travelers encounter the same vehicle later, and what they believe is a man dumping a human body into a drainage pipe. Investigating, Darry and Trish become the intended prey of an indestructible, supernatural creature hell-bent on eating them, a murderous local myth that is proving to be all too real. As they attempt to escape their bloodthirsty pursuer, the pair discovers that even the local police station is no refuge; they also receive some advice from a knowledgeable psychic (Patricia Belcher). Jeepers Creepers co-stars Eileen Brennan(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: A trio of American astronauts become instant heroes as they plant the Stars and Stripes on Mars before beginning the voyage home. But back on their ship, something else has set its sights on Earth... something whose relatives have already paid us a visit(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: A boy stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground during a family trip to the Grand Canyon in this skin-crawling tale of terror. He takes five sacred stones from there back home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force(n)

programme.title: The Gallows
programme.desc: High-school students restage a play that ended in horrific tragedy in order to honor the 20th anniversary of the event. However, they soon realize that their plan is a deadly mistake(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays the eponymous hero in John Singleton's tough thriller, an ex-cop who sets out to nail Walter Wade Jnr., a killer using his rich kid connections to escape conviction. But as Shaft's net draws tighter, he has to contend with killers employed by a desperate Wade(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A killer cyborg is sent from the future to kill the mother of a would-be resistance leader(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A young couple are terrorized by three masked intruders at a secluded country house in this grimly efficient exercise in horror and suspense(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Kane gives a killer performance as a deranged, hulking psychopath who terrorizes eight teens working to rehab a decrepit hotel. It's no-holds-barred mayhem as the murderer employs a variety of different weapons and instruments to dispatch his victims. Directed by Gregory Dark. WWE head Vince McMahon serves as executive producer. Steven Vidler, Christina Vidal, Michael J. Pagan, Samantha Noble, Cecily Polson, Luke Pegler, Penny McNamee, Craig Horner(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: A box office smash and written by Slyvestor Stallone as the version of 'Beverly Hills Cop' he wanted to make. Based on the novel 'Fair Game' and also stars Brigitte Nielsen(n)

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: An A-list actor and his posse of best buds navigate the perils and pleasures of Hollywood life(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In the next installment of the "Maze Runner" franchise Thomas (Dylan O'Brien), Teresa (Kaya Scodelario) and the rest of the Gladers search for clues about WCKD, a powerful organization in the Scorch, a bleak landscape that is filled with dangerous obstacles. The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. Cast includes Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Giancarlo Esposito, Aidan Gillen, Ki Hong Lee, Barry Pepper, Lili Taylor and Patricia Clarkson(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: A mysterious wanderer looks for dry land after Earth is engulfed by water(n)

programme.desc: A couple destined to be together find each other at the worst possible time. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2015 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Children
programme.desc: After a nuclear power plant leaks poison gas, the children on a school bus are transformed into zombies(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: An authority on rare books is drawn into a confrontation with the forces of darkness in this thriller directed by Roman Polanski. Dean Corso (Johnny Depp) is a rare book broker who makes his living tracking down valuable items for rich bibliophiles. Corso is hired by Boris Balkan (Frank Langella), a millionaire New Yorker with a vast collection of occult literature and a keen interest in "The Nine Gates to the Kingdom of Shadows." Legend has it that the book was co-written by Satan in the 17th century, and only three copies are known to exist; the owner of one recently sold the book to Balkan a few days before killing himself. Balkan wants Corso to find the other two copies (one owned by a Mr. Fargas in Portugal and the other by a French collector named Kessler) and examine them to determine if they are forgeries. Corso is told to be thorough and spare no expense. He begins by visiting Liana Telfer (Lena Olin), the widow of the man who once owned Balkan's copy of the book, who has an unusually strong desire to get the book back, and confers with his friend Bernie (James Russo), who soon turns up dead, in a manner much like an illustration from the book. Corso learns that the book contains clues to a puzzle that will allow people to call up the devil, and certain people will stop at nothing to find the missing parts of the formula(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Wesley Gibson, un hombre apocado, descubre que su padre, a quien nunca conoció y que fue recientemente asesinado, pertenecía a una sociedad secreta de asesinos. Después de que una atractiva mujer vestida de cuero lo recluta y lo hace miembro de la socieda(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: A lab-created human/alien hybrid goes on a killing spree while searching for a man who can impregnate her. Meanwhile, the scientist responsible for her creation brings together a motley crew in order to stop her(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Tom Witzky is a regular guy whose life is turned upside down after he is hypnotised by his sister-in-law. The hypnosis unlocks a latent power that allows Tom to see glimpses of supernatural forces. Suddenly, his ordinary life is invaded with violent flashes of horrific images he cannot explain(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: An Iraq War veteran returns home after a firefight which left him in a coma and took the lives of several civilians. Soon after arriving, he is wracked with guilt and plagued by dreams of a burning man who wants something from him. After being denied treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder, he enlists the help of a psychic to help him understand, and hopefully conquer, his terrifying visions(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A disturbing videotape appears to hold the power of life and death over those who view it in this offbeat thriller. A strange videotape begins making the rounds in a town in the Pacific Northwest; it is full of bizarre and haunting images, and after watching it, many viewers receive a telephone call in which they are warned they will die in seven days. A handful of teenagers who watched the tape while spending a weekend at a cabin in the mountains scoff at the threat, but as predicted, they all die suddenly on the same night. Rachel Keller (Naomi Watts), the aunt of one of the ill-fated teens, is a journalist who has decided to investigate the matter and travels West with her young son, Aidan (David Dorfman), a troubled child who has been drawing pictures of strange and ominous visions. Rachel managed to find the cabin in the woods and watches the video herself; afterward, she receives the same phone call, and realizes she must solve the puzzle of the video and the person or persons behind it within a week. Rachel turns to her ex, Noah (Martin Henderson), an expert in video technology, who at first is convinced the story is a hoax until he digs deeper into the mystery. The Ring was adapted from a 1996 Japanese film by Hideo Nakata, which became a massive box-office success in Asia and spawned two sequels(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: A mid-air paragliding collision has HMS Gannet's helicopter squadron speeding to a dramatic cliff rescue on the Isle of Arran and paramedics rush to a 90-year-old who has fallen in her home on the Isle of Man .(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a two-bedroom flat in Woodford Green, London, a three-bedroom terrace in the Welsh Valleys and a one-bedroom flat in Middleton, Greater Manchester. After the properties are auctioned, they then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: New series. Sheriffs Tommy and Craig chase money owed by a clothing manufacturer and Lawrence and Kev are on the hunt for a stables manager who the court says owes money.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright finds out how the National Crime Agency is cracking down on suspected ID fakers, and reveals how forged autographs have fooled young Doctor Who fans. Plus, a warning about a bogus dental tool that is being sold to surgeries nationwide.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Richard Madley are in Detling, Kent, to help two teams pick up items to sell at auction, while Charlie Ross asks people to evaluate a well-loved soft toy.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Valerie turns to Daniel for advice when a patient appears to be lying, while JJ feels rejected when Mrs Tembe fails to introduce him to one of her friends.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Airline pilot Paul from Surrey answers questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright hosts, with help from Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple who are looking to return to Devon, where they first met, and have their sights set on a property in a rural location on a budget of £425,000.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades saves three items from a recycling centre in Walsall, West Midlands, including a set of six swivel chairs, a fireplace hearth and a set of coat hooks.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team present from Guildford Cathedral in Surrey. Antiques expert James Lewis examines First World War medals, while Mark Stacey finds a Poole Pottery vase. Paul also reveals the story of Marianne North, a pioneering and adventurous artist who travelled the world.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allright reports on the counterfeit lifesaving equipment that was introduced into the NHS, as well as fake cashmere being sold online that could contain rat fur and the story of the bogus ice cream vans that threatened the survival of a British classic.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The highs and lows of life with the residents of Albert Square, Walford.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Marine Le Pen: Who's Funding France's Far Right? - Panorama.
programme.desc: The French people vote for a new president in a few weeks and far-right National Front (FN) candidate Marine Le Pen has her sights set on victory and is trying to distance herself from the party's racist and anti-Semitic past. In this programme, Gabriel Gatehouse explores how the FN's desperate need for money could be undermining this process, meeting fixers and insiders who have helped Le Pen run her campaign and raise money from controversial sources around the world.(n)

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary charting the development of 25 children born at the start of the millennium returns to follow the participants as they turn 16. Robert Winston and Tanya Byron discover how the teenagers' changing brains means that what they choose to do at this age can shape their lives forever, and explore research in human biology and neuroscience that reveals how the most baffling aspects of this stage of life can be explained and illuminated by the latest understanding of the changing teenage brain.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Agnes and the family are joined by Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield, who are put through their paces in the Brown family version of The Cube, while Lulu pops in for a chat. Dermot and Buster recruit EastEnders' icon Adam Woodyatt and get him to spout wildly inaccurate facts to the tour group along the way to help with their new business venture, and Ricky Wilson gets intimate with Agnes in Foley's pub before the Kaiser Chiefs play out with their latest hit Hole in My Soul.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Comedian Frankie Boyle hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster Julia Hartley-Brewer and Citizen Khan star Adil Ray joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: The Cornwall Air Ambulance rushes to a remote location where a man is having a stroke, a Warwickshire police officer cracks down on dodgy drivers, and when Isle of Man paramedics are called to help a pensioner who has fallen, they suspect he is suffering from something more serious.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties about to be auctioned in Sutton Coldfield, Kent and Suffolk, then talk to the buyers about their plans.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Enforcement officers meet a dealer who sold a potentially lethal second-hand car, and Sheriff Lawrence discovers his claimant is not the only one owed money by a building company.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Investigating the increasing number of false Facebook profiles that are fast becoming a nuisance to people's lives, a look at the fake washing powder that is actually a danger to the public, and how one man nearly lost out on his inheritance as a result of a sham will. Presented by Matt Allwright.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion meets best pals and a father and son who buy three items per team and compete to make the most profit at auction in Newbury, Brackley.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Mrs Tembe introduces her new beau, but when she makes a surprise announcement, her friends wonder if she is making the right decision, while Al and Ayesha share their family woes.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts as yesterday's contestants Nick, Waheeza and Matt return to the quiz show to continue their quest to crack the code and take home the prize money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley assists a couple searching for a home in the north Dorset countryside, and while in the area, she visits the renowned Lyme Regis Boat Building Academy.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a skip in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, including a dressing table and mirrors and an old rusty water tank.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at Blackpool Tower Circus, where expert James Lewis discovers a glass bowl that was bought at a car-boot sale. Plus, Anita Manning gives her opinion on a diamond and pearl necklace, and Paul investigates the historical use of warhorses.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The highs and lows of life with the residents of Albert Square, Walford.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.sub-title: It's Only Love If It Hurts.
programme.desc: Serena faces her demons and comes to a heart-wrenching conclusion. Meanwhile, Zosia takes action when Isaac reveals his true colours, and Mo risks her professional reputation when she goes the extra mile.(n)

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professors Robert Winston and Tanya Byron follow the youngsters through their GCSE year to discover how the teenagers are being shaped by these unique times. In Scotland, Nathan shares how it feels growing up in an unconventional family - attitudes to his father's homosexuality have transformed in his lifetime. And in Essex, Taliesin reveals what impact his online gaming habit is having on friendships and his sleep.(n)

programme.title: The Richard Dimbleby Lecture
programme.desc: Former CIA director John O Brennan discusses the future security and stability of the world, drawing on his experience of intelligence collection and analysis and covert operations to determine how societies will protect themselves in the face of turbulent global events.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin joins a research expedition across the Galapagos Islands, the vast archipelago where evolution has proceeded at an extraordinary pace. The journey begins on the west side, home to a richly diverse wildlife scene, where Liz and the scientists journey into the clouds above the islands' tallest volcano on a hunt for the endangered pink iguana. Liz also travels to one of the most remote locations in the Galapagos in search of giant tortoises, and boards a submersible to dive for a new species.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts explore the frivolous end of the market, with Philip Serrell explaining his love of antique toy cars, while Paul Martin travels to Coventry to learn more about the real thing - a vintage Alvis. Charlie Ross learns what goes into creating possible collectibles of the future.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Metropolitan Police officers try to identify a suspect accused of killing a man and shooting a policeman in Brazil, back in November 1994. A Welshman who became a multi-million pound drug smuggler is arrested in South Africa. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore enlists the help of Mark Haig to turn a Second World War field telephone into something functional again. She also brings an Edwardian single bed into the 21st century.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Burton Constable Hall near Hull, where historic items brought in to be valued include a series of letters written by Florence Nightingale, the diaries of an SS officer held as a prisoner of war in Britain, the first ever piece of transatlantic air mail, and a collection of 1500 shoe buckles.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Conversations
programme.desc: Sean Curran talks to former Conservative MP Ann Widdecombe about her life and political career.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Len takes former EastEnders star Pam St Clement back to Dartmoor in Devon to relive a memorable period she enjoyed in the area in 1953. The pair visit the farm she stayed in as Pam explains how its owners - Courty and Sylvia - took her under their wings and became her extended family.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: South Yorkshire-born actor and adventurer Brian Blessed explores the lives of his ancestors on a journey that takes him to Doncaster, London and Portsmouth. Seeking to discover the source of his spirit for adventure - he is the oldest man to have reached the North Magnetic Pole - the veteran performer uncovers the life of his great-great-grandfather Jabez Blessed, who as an orphan lived rough on the streets of London before growing up to father 13 children.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Richard is called to the scene when a calf's mother collapses, while Sybil has to break some difficult news to a concerned horse owner. Plus, vets in Fife treat puppies that have eaten a potentially deadly amount of ibuprofen, and Megan deals with a chinchilla with problematic teeth. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: France: The Wild Side: Natural World.
programme.desc: Paul McGann narrates a documentary examining France's wildlife, revealing wolves, wild boar and even bears living in the country's many mountains, valleys and forests, from the Pyrenees to the Alps and all around the mainland to the island of Corsica.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough's documentary charting the circle of life in the animal kingdom ends with creatures' attempts to rear their offspring, revealing the commitment involved and how for some parents it means risking their own lives. A turtle hauls itself up the beach to lay its eggs in a safe place, only for the tide to trap it behind a wall of coral. A mother bonobo in the Congo teaches its son the skills it will need to survive adulthood, bison protect their calves from the ever-present threat of wolves and a mother zebra has to lead its foal across a dangerous river.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant begin a new road trip, travelling across Ireland in a 1962 Bedford van. The journey starts in Cashel, Co Tipperary, from where they embark on a trip to an auction in Birr, Co Offaly.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a painting, a ceramic plaque and a Japanese lacquered jewellery box.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Sabine Schmitz compete in a buggy race across the Californian desert that is one of the toughest events in motorsport, and Matt LeBlanc test drives new supercar the Ford GT.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The University of Edinburgh takes on Balliol College, Oxford, in the second semi-final of the competition, which was won last year by Peterhouse, Cambridge. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.sub-title: When You Want to Show Off.
programme.desc: Mary and her husband celebrate their 50th wedding anniversary, and she shares her secrets on how to create surprisingly easy showstoppers, including canapes inspired by the 1960s. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at Mashpi Lodge in Ecuador, which is 900 metres above sea level and features a gondola cable car that transports guests a mile through the rainforest canopy. The pair reveal the challenges of delivering the highest standards of experience in the midst of teeming wildlife, mud and moisture, as well as the eco-tourism that is saving thousands of species, and also spend time with their new co-workers at home, hearing moving stories of how local people's lives have been transformed by the arrival of the hotel.(n)

programme.title: Cradle to Grave
programme.desc: Romance is in the air as Sharon's wedding brings up old memories for Bet and Fred, taking the couple back to their courtship in 1949. Meanwhile, Danny receives an interesting lecture from Yvonne. Nostalgic 1970s comedy based on the memoirs of DJ Danny Baker, starring Peter Kay, Laurie Kynaston, Lucy Speed and Alexa Davies. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: When Danny Won the Masters
programme.desc: The story of Danny Willett's surprise 2016 Masters victory at Augusta, which saw him become the first British golfer to win the Major event since 1996.(n)

programme.title: Incredible Medicine: Dr Weston's Casebook
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston continues to unlock the secrets of the human body, hearing the stories of a man who fixed his own heart and a girl whose immune system attacked her own brain. Dr Weston also hears the remarkable story of a man who can taste words, and how his condition is helping develop new ways for blind people to navigate and recognise colours. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of Louis XIV. In the first edition, the young monarch seeks to assert his authority on court and country, but faces resistance and betrayal, even from those closest to him. Starring George Blagden.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: This week's show comes from Denbighshire, where Matt baker meets one of the country's most successful sheep farmers while Ellie Harrison observes the spring mating rituals of grouse and goes in search of adders on the moorland. Sean Fletcher meets an artist who makes edible flowers, Adam Henson visits a college in Cumbria that provides a sheepdog training course, and Tom Heap examines the future of British farming.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Steph McGovern head to North London to help sales manager Kevin and estate agent Yolanda, a shopping obsessed couple desperate to save some money for their upcoming wedding. Having recently lost an incredible 16 stone between them, newly found confidence has led to a shopping obsession, each of them buying new clothes to flatter their new frames. Plus, Alex visits British lingerie brand Rigby and Peller to find out what we should be looking for when it comes to bras.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the show's experts offer advice on making money from an array of antique weapons and medical instruments.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: New series. Sheriffs Tommy and Craig chase money owed by a clothing manufacturer and Lawrence and Kev are on the hunt for a stables manager who the court says owes money.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades saves three items from a recycling centre in Walsall, West Midlands, including a set of six swivel chairs, a fireplace hearth and a set of coat hooks.(n)

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup and Rev Richard Coles present the final from Greenwich. At Queen's House, the artists are challenged to paint a portrait, but are not told who the subject is until the sitting begins. For the last test of the series, the painters must depict the Old Royal Naval College as seen from the Thames - and mentors Diana Ali and Pascal Anson are not on hand to help this time. Judges Lachlan Goudie, Daphne Todd and David Dibosa assess their efforts and reveal who is this series' champion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest Super League matches, including Leeds Rhinos v Wigan Warriors at Headingley and Salford Red Devils v St Helens at the AJ Bell Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.desc: A look back at last year's tournament in Augusta, which saw England's Danny Willett win his first Major following a dramatic collapse by defending champion Jordan Spieth.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Vet Rosie treats a concussed tawny owl, while equine specialist Kerry helps a horse with a badly cut face. Meanwhile, in Fife, Adam has an emotional case on his hands when an owner suffering from a debilitating phobia discovers the dog he depends on has a worrying lump. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble - Into the Volcano
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kate joins a team of geologists on a research expedition to the Vanuatu archipelago in the southern Pacific, beginning at Mount Yasur on the island of Tanna, one of the most active volcanos in the world. To discover whether a devastating eruption might happen, the scientists need to collect a lava bomb the minute it is hurled from the crater and while they prepare for their mission, Kate explores the island and discovers how the volcano shapes the lives, traditions and beliefs of everyone who lives in its shadow.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough's Paradise Birds
programme.desc: Among David Attenborough's life-long passions are birds of paradise, which he has tracked all over the jungles of New Guinea to film their beautiful and often bizarre displays. In this documentary, he examines how and why these creatures have captivated explorers, naturalists, artists, film-makers and even royalty, investigating the myths surrounding their discovery 500 years ago, the latest extraordinary behaviour captured on camera and the science behind their beauty. He also travels to a state-of-the art facility in Qatar that houses the largest breeding group of these birds in the world.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Thomas Plant and Christina Trevanion visit Co Kildare and Dublin, and try to uncover some hidden gems to take to auction in Wrexham.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores two Royal Worcester vases that are precious family heirlooms, along with a Cirencester village clock and a 19th-century hay press.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: St Louis to Jefferson City, Missouri.
programme.desc: New series. Michael Portillo continues his American rail journey west to Jefferson City, Missouri, following the tracks of European settlers in the 19th century. In St Louis he ascends America's monument to the Wild West, the Gateway Arch, the tallest free-standing monument in the US. On the banks of the Missouri River, the political commentator is invited aboard a replica of the original keel boat used for an historic expedition. In Washington, Missouri, Michael tries to craft a corn cob pipe, and in Jefferson City he finds an huge fortified building that served as the gaol for the entire Wild West.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: New series. The pastry contest returns in a revamped knockout format, as five teams battle to stay in the competition and make it through to the next heat. First, they are challenged to make 36 identical Moka au Cafe slices and Napoleons in just three hours, before creating a showpiece dessert inspired by the classic Peach Melba. Hosted by Angus Deayton.(n)

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When he was 12 years old, Sharron Townsend was arrested for shooting a homeless man in the head. Now aged 14, he is facing justice. As this edition reveals, in Florida, children can be transferred to adult courts at the discretion of the State Attorney, so there is no upper limit on Sharron's sentence. Cameras also follow Jeremiah Hill, who shot a man during a gun trade when he was 13 years old. Now the justice system must decide how best to protect society.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Today is Andy's first day as a volunteer at Comfort Support Line's call centre, which offers the lonely and desperate a chance to talk about their problems. All the CSL counsellors have their own ways of dealing with clients, coping with the emotional stress and killing time between phone calls, but is Andy really prepared for what's to come? Comedy written, directed by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Jane Horrocks.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the second half of the journey, Simon travels along the Black Sea Coast to the capital of Ankara and the Northern Highlands, witnessing first hand the aftermath of fighting in Kurdish areas and meeting a conservationist attempting to preserve the region's brown bears. He then returns to Istanbul, where he takes part in a popular TV series set in the palace of the Ottoman Sultans.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: First in a five-part series in which Dr Adam Rutherford investigates the close relationship between discoveries in anatomy and the works of art that illustrate them. He begins by focusing on Roman anatomist Claudius Galen and artist and part-time dissector Leonardo da Vinci.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.(n)

programme.title: Roof Racks and Hatchbacks: The Family Car
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the British experience of the family car, from the groundbreaking Morris Minor to the ubiquitous Ford Cortina, and the Range Rover to the new Jaguar F-Pace. The film looks at how designers have long endeavoured to make the family car attractive, even exciting, and to keep pace as the family and its requirements have evolved over the decades. Narrated by Grace Dent.(n)

programme.title: The Queen Mary: Greatest Ocean Liner
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life of the Clyde-built ship, from the maiden voyage in May 1936 to New York, and her 1939 role in the Battle of the Atlantic, to her current status as a floating luxury hotel and museum in Long Beach, California. Among the contributors are singer Johnny Mathis.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The crew embarks on a journey through the Mediterranean Sea, whose coasts are among the most densely populated in the world, to explore the profound effect man has had on the body of water. Paul Rose and the team also visit the remains of a Roman shipwreck and, under the cover of night, dive the Straits of Messina, hoping to find and film the sixgill shark - one of the largest predatory sharks in the world.(n)

programme.title: Chef vs Science: The Ultimate Kitchen Challenge
programme.desc: Materialist scientist Professor Mark Miodownik challenges two Michelin star chef Marcus Wareing to the ultimate head-to-head cookery contest, to see who can create the most flavoursome food. Marcus has flair and experience, whereas Mark has an understanding of cooking at the molecular level, as well as access to state-of-the-art technology. Over the course of 90 minutes, the pair will cook some of the nation's best-loved dishes, from starter to dessert, as they try to answer the question of whether cooking is a science or an art.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Meades: The Joy of Essex
programme.desc: In a documentary about the county mocked for its stereotyped image as the home of nail bars, nightclubs and tanning salons, Jonathan Meades discovers there is a lot more to Essex than meets the eye. As he explores its buildings and history, he comes across picturesque villages and modernist architecture, as well as the story of one of the world's first temperance societies. He also learns how because of its proximity to London, the county was used for social experiments by 19th-century reformers, who thought its fresh air was just the thing for `outcasts' from the capital.(n)

programme.title: Roof Racks and Hatchbacks: The Family Car
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the British experience of the family car, from the groundbreaking Morris Minor to the ubiquitous Ford Cortina, and the Range Rover to the new Jaguar F-Pace. The film looks at how designers have long endeavoured to make the family car attractive, even exciting, and to keep pace as the family and its requirements have evolved over the decades. Narrated by Grace Dent.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: Dr Adam Rutherford examines the story of Andreas Vesalius, who in 1537 became the most famous anatomist in Europe. He went on to produce the first complete account of the human body and how to dissect it, and his drawings set the standard for anatomical art for centuries to come, earning him the title of `the founder of modern anatomy'.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: As Dan Snow's docudrama continues, King Harold has to take on two invasion forces. First, his brother Tostig attacks the south coast. He is repelled, but there is more to come. Later in the year, a vast Viking invasion force led by King Harald Hardrada of Norway lands in the north of England. Harold rushes to Stamford Bridge to fight for his kingdom and for his life.(n)

programme.title: How To Be A Surrealist with Philippa Perry
programme.desc: Psychotherapist Philippa Perry discovers the roots of Surrealism established in the political upheavals of 1920s Europe, and examines new ways of understanding the human psyche.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Surrealist: Desmond Morris
programme.desc: Since the 1960s, Desmond Morris has been known as a zoologist and expert on human behaviour - but the author of The Naked Ape and Manwatching has led a double life. By day, a rational scientist, writer and broadcaster with a mission to explain, and by night, a painter of dreamlike images, which mystify even Morris himself. This documentary looks at his lifelong fascination with the process and the genre.(n)

programme.title: Un Chien Andalou
programme.desc: A vintage collection of surreal and shocking images from the imaginations of Salvador Dali and Luis Bunuel. Starring Simone Mareuil, Pierre Batcheff and Jaime Miravilles.(n)

programme.title: Spike Milligan: Assorted Q
programme.desc: First of a two-part compilation of clips from the enduringly popular comedian's pioneering sketch shows from the 1970s, featuring material that ranges from the surreal and influential to the sublime. programme.title: Spike Milligan: Assorted Q

programme.desc: Director Jenny Shepard tries to solve the murder of an underworld source who was prepared to give information on the activities of arms dealer La Grenouille. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Two FBI agents try to seize control of the team's investigation into the discovery of a perfectly preserved body hidden in a chimney at a marine base. Reluctant to be ousted from the case, Gibbs agrees to work with them - and learns the victim was a serial killer responsible for the deaths of 14 people. Meanwhile, McGee's literary efforts lead to discord with the others.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Sloan tries to find meaning in a murdered private eye's last words, while Jack and Steve vie for the attentions of the dead man's secretary. Drama, starring Dick Van Dyke.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: The mother of a group of outlaws tries to stop her youngest son from following in his older brothers' footsteps. Guest starring Kim Hunter and Jan-Michael Vincent.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Gambler Luke Calhoun and his daughter cause chaos when they arrive in the Ponderosa after he loses all his money in a stock scheme.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team flies to Israel, but receives a hostile reception from Ziva's father, who is the head of intelligence agency Mossad. As events unfold, Gibbs learns that Ziva was romantically involved with Rivkin and finds himself forced to make a tough decision. Guest starring Michael Nouri, alongside Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Marine Brandon Valdivia falls to his death from a rooftop bar and is initially thought to have committed suicide, but his family refuse to accept that possibility and persuade a congressman to put some pressure on the admiral. Sam and Callen are then brought in to re-evaluate the case and discover that Valdivia may have been involved in money laundering with a fellow marine.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a marine off the coast of Tanzania - a case complicated by the discovery that he had a link to Ziva. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A woman is shot dead in an apartment while keeping watch on a man on a yacht in a marina, and the killer takes her camera and computer. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 303. Products include jewelry designed by a 10-year-old and a wedge pillow to allow women with large breasts to sleep comfortably on their stomachs. Also: a way to deal with missing garbage-can lids; a reinvention of "the tea experience"; an update on a peel-and-stick light-up decal for car windows(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 301. An Illinois perfume peddler; a San Francisco woman selling luxury soap; an Alabama guitar teacher who says his learning system is unique; a "Mr. Mom" from Baton Rouge, La., with accessories for blue jeans. Also: an update on a gourmet seafood business from Season 2(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 615. Dog chews made from yak and cow milk are pitched to the Sharks. Other products include colorful lipsticks that are organic; and there's an update on protein-packed nut spreads invested in by Robert and Mark during Season 4(n)

programme.title: The Partner
programme.desc: People, Process, Product, Partner. Marcus chooses the final two candidates and gives them their most important challenge yet—spending a day in his shoes—which involves assessing a struggling local business and putting together an investment plan(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 413. A couple from Boulder pitch sandals for barefoot runners; a rabbi from St. Paul presents his idea for an iPad-sound enhancer; a Miami homemaker hopes to drum up interest in her made-in-America bibs; and a father of seven from Hollywood talks up his Web site for creating personalized children's soundtracks. Also: an update on a Season 4 investment in a food truck that serves up lobster(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 519. One product has the men competing against the women. Included: whimsical plush slippers; an alternative to human sign holders; trousers and leggings that provide a butt lift; and a line of snack nuts with bold flavors. Also: an update on CordaRoys Beanbag Beds, which Lori Greiner invested in during Season 4(n)
