programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: Set in 1953, Mona Lisa Smile tells the story of Katherine Watson (Julia Roberts), a new young art history professor at Wellesley College, an all-female campus with a prestigious reputation for academic excellence. Unfortunately for free-minded Berkeley grad Watson, her East Coast teaching stint comes during a less-progressive time that finds most of her students -- among them Betty Warren (Kirsten Dunst), Joan Brandwyn (Julia Stiles), and Giselle Levy (Maggie Gyllenhaal) -- more interested in nabbing a good husband than achieving scholastic and intellectual growth. Watson challenges her students and the Wellesley faculty to think outside of the current mores of the community and redefine what it means to be a success; meanwhile, she tries to come to terms with her own heart's desires. Mona Lisa Smile co-stars Marcia Gay Harden, Juliet Stevenson, and, as Watson's conflicting love interests, Dominic West and John Slattery(n)

programme.desc: Yann Martel's ponderous adventure novel gets the big-screen treatment with this Fox 2000 adaptation helmed by director Ang Lee. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Badman. When the annual Candy Industry Trade Show comes to Springfield, noted sugar enthusiast Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) arrives to load up on free samples, with his embarrassed wife, Marge (voice of Julie Kavner), in tow. Homer's feeble willpower is quickly stretched to the breaking point, and he swipes the rarest item at the show -- a gummy Venus de Milo, "carved by gummy artisans who work exclusively in the medium of gummy." After arriving home from the show, Marge asks Homer to give the babysitter, feminist-minded college student Ashley Grant (voice of Pamela Hayden), a ride home. As Ashley is getting out of the car, Homer notices the precious gummy Venus de Milo is stuck to her bottom, and he quickly peels it off; Ashley is certain Homer was making a sexual advance, and accuses him of harassment. As Ashley and a group of protesters set up camp on the Simpsons' front lawn, a tabloid TV reporter interviews Homer, and through the magic of editing makes him sound like a subnormal degenerate, so suddenly Homer is the pariah of the community. "Homer Badman" also features the voice of Dennis Franz, who stars in a quickie TV movie modeled after Homer's notoriety, "Homer S.: Portrait of an Ass-Grabber." The episode first aired on November 24, 1994(n)

programme.title: The Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Three men gather at the funeral of a Spanish actress and countess who rose from peasant origins to become a Hollywood star. A movie director recalls how he made her famous, a PR agent remembers her doomed romance with a millionaire, and her aristocratic husband contemplates the events that destroyed their marriage. Satirical drama in flashback format, with Ava Gardner, Humphrey Bogart, Edmond O'Brien, Rossano Brazzi and Marius Goring.(n)

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: An American war correspondent joins Allied troops in 1944 as they prepare for their landing in Italy. A strategic blunder by their commanding officer gives German forces time to reinforce the area, leaving the reporter caught up in one of the campaign's fiercest battles. Second World War drama, starring Robert Mitchum, Peter Falk, Arthur Kennedy, Robert Ryan and Earl Holliman.(n)

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: One-eyed, over-the-hill US Marshal Rooster Cogburn reluctantly agrees to help a girl track down her father's killer. The quest is complicated by a Texas Ranger, who is also on the murderer's trail, and a host of villains who have few qualms about disposing of the meddling youngster and her protector. Western, starring an Oscar-winning John Wayne alongside Jeff Corey, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Feisty heroine Annie and her new boyfriend Alex take a cruise in the Bahamas, but the trip becomes a nightmare when they discover a vengeful computer genius - a former employee laid off because of his terminal illness - is also on board. He has secretly programmed the ship to crash into an oil tanker while he steals a cache of diamonds from the cargo. Action thriller sequel, with Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: The Other Woman
programme.desc: A woman is devastated to learn her boyfriend is actually married, but when she meets his wife, they quickly become friends. When they discover he has a third secret lover, they decide to join forces and teach him a lesson. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Leslie Mann, Kate Upton and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau.(n)

programme.title: Unfaithful
programme.desc: A New York woman with a seemingly perfect marriage has an accidental encounter with a charming Frenchman. Their physical attraction is immediate, and although she realises she is risking everything, she cannot help herself from being drawn into a passionate affair. In time her husband grows suspicious, and eventually confronts her lover with a level of anger he never imagined himself capable of. Thriller, with Diane Lane, Olivier Martinez and Richard Gere.(n)

programme.title: The Joneses
programme.desc: A seemingly perfect family moves into a community and instantly arouses the envy of their neighbours. What the townsfolk do not realise is the newcomers have been placed there for precisely that purpose - they are a living exercise in product placement, designed to drive those around them into a frenzy of jealous consumption. Satirical comedy, with David Duchovny and Demi Moore.(n)

programme.title: Down to the Sea in Ships
programme.desc: Sea captain Bering Joy takes his grandson Jed on a whaling trip to teach him about life's challenges and truths, while first mate Dan Lunceford's assignment to look after the lad has dramatic consequences on a voyage packed with incident and danger. Seafaring adventure, starring Lionel Barrymore, Richard Widmark, and Dean Stockwell.(n)

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: A man wrongly accused of murder flees from the authorities to start a new life in a Mexican border town. He ends up helping the local sheriff deal with a corrupt rancher's crooked schemes, while falling for the lawman's sister. However, his new-found happiness is threatened when his face starts to appear on wanted posters. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Lin McCarthy, Alan Baxter and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush.(n)

programme.title: Comanche
programme.desc: A powerful Native American chief agrees to take part in peace talks with Washington after an encounter with a sympathetic scout. However, a group of renegade warriors are unwilling to surrender their arms and their actions prompt a bigoted government official to use brutal methods. Western, starring Dana Andrews, Kent Smith, Nestor Paiva and Henry Brandon.(n)

programme.title: Admission
programme.desc: A by-the-book university admissions officer visits an unconventional school run by a former college friend to interview a gifted student. She begins to suspect the pupil may be the son she gave up for adoption, and the experience makes her rethink her uncompromising outlook on life. Comedy drama, with Tina Fey and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic soldier uses technology that allows him to control a genetically engineered body on a mission to a dangerous jungle world. His assignment is to infiltrate an alien tribe on behalf of a corrupt mining corporation, which wants to drive them from their land. He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang.(n)

programme.desc: The pastry chef demonstrates how nut cakes can range from the most simple to elaborate grand tortes, and shares a few recipes.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: Anna Olson demonstrates how to prepare a caramel apple jalousie.(n)

programme.title: Ace of Cakes
programme.desc: The staff become silent-film stars, and Duff prepares a dessert buffet.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's prepares chicken mozzarella pasta, shrimp scampi for her and the girls, pasta puttanesca for a solo meal and quick shells and cheese for the boys.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond creates a menu with black beans at the centre, including mango guacamole and taco pizza, as well as grilled veggie burritos and a quick black bean burger.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's sister visits the ranch, so frittata, kale citrus salad, mystery rolls and lemon and lime pound cake are on the menu for an evening of cooking and eating.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares a delicious Tex-Mex tailgate lunch, including a beef taco bar, green chilli queso, chipotle salsa and chilli beans and sugar cookies.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul looks back over his incredible journey into the baking of the world's cities, and showcases some of his favourite moments spent with the bakers themselves.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The baker and celebrity chef travels to cities around the world to visit local bakeries and the bakers who work there. In the first edition, Paul heads to New York, where he discovers how doughnuts have been recreated with fresh, innovative flavours. Plus, he meets internet sensation Jim Lahey, who has invented a new, simple way of baking bread at home.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Food writer and chef Ching-He Huang assists two personal trainers who want to win their friends' approval with a couple of spicy suppers. On the menu are chilli chicken and cashew nuts, and chilli bean cod with an exotic mushroom stir-fry.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang tutors two students from Durham in the ways of fine oriental dining, teaching them how to prepare easy and cheap Chinese food to replace their usual mince-based recipes. Among the dishes highlighted are fried sweet chilli chicken, spicy Sichuan aubergine and griddled yellow-bean pork.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: With his campaign drawing to a close, Jamie Oliver is unsure the lessons he has taught to the people of Rotherham will stick after his departure. With this in mind, he approaches the local council in the hope that it will encourage the population to continue living healthily. He also organises a series of Pass It On street parties, culminating in a bash for the entire town. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her sister-in-law throw an engagement do for her friend, with appetisers and prime rib on the menu. Plus, there are glasses of fizz to toast the future Mr and Mrs.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The boys fix up a man cave on the ranch, while Ree Drummond makes them chicken bacon ranch paninis, steak fingers and gravy with a mini chopped salad, and brownies.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Two carpenters hope to swap their hammers for woks and learn to make quick and easy oriental dishes, so cook Ching-He Huang teaches them how to prepare noodle-based dishes, including rice wine and peppered beef, Taiwanese ginger and sesame chicken, and mixed seafood.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang heads for London to lend her expertise to two American entrepreneurs keen to enjoy a diverse diet, but struggling to fit time in the kitchen into their busy lives. She teaches them how to prepare spicy chunky lamb, pork and water chestnut dumplings and duck spring rolls.(n)

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: The final four bakers create Memorial Day desserts, with the freedom to create a dessert of their choosing as long as it's red, white and blue.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers embark on a quest to lose weight while still enjoying the food they love by creating healthier versions of their favourite recipes. They also search for ways to make their lifestyles more active - including swapping their beloved motorbikes for pedal-powered machines - and learn why obesity is an increasingly serious problem in 21st-century Britain.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri travels to Koreatown, Los Angeles where he visits a craft beer restaurant who are putting duck into their fries and the French dip.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Toronto, Canada, to sample pork belly, a mac and cheese burger and a Christmas burger at a restored diner.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a place cooking lamb in indoor smokers, an Italian deli making ravioli on a century-old machine, and a pizza oven in Hawaii creating island twists on meaty pies.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Toronto, Canada, to sample pork belly, a mac and cheese burger and a Christmas burger at a restored diner.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Owner of Nauna's Bella Casa restaurant asks for help to figure out what his staff are doing when he is not around that is costing him valuable customers.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After noticing an excess of lobster meat, Peter, owner of the Roll 'n' Lobster Food Truck in Los Angeles believes his new drivers are using his vehicle for personal errands, so seeks the team's advice.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Pelons Tex-Mex Restaurant in Austin, Texas contacts Charles for advice after hearing rumours that his staff are collecting money for an unauthorised charity.(n)

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads return to work on an ambitious engineering project, with new member Wyman filling in for his late, lamented dad Wayne. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' popular comedy drama, starring Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Tim Healy.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

programme.desc: ohn Catucci learns the secret to great barbecue in Sault St Marie, Ontario, and in Toronto, he discovers the international flavours of Phillipine cooking at Casa Manila.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Prohibition Montreal, Battista's Calzone Co, Burgers N' Fries Forever.
programme.desc: John Catucci has brunch at Montreal's Prohibition, then tries the specialty at Battista's Calzone Co in Edmonton, before visiting Burgers 'n' Fries Forever in Ottawa.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The six remaining contestants head for Sarre Windmill in Kent for the third round of the competition. Here, they are challenged to bake the perfect loaf, under the watchful eyes of Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Meanwhile, Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins taste Britain's earliest bread roll and discover the hidden history of the sandwich.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first two semi-finalists are challenged to work a shift at the two Michelin-starred Dinner by Heston Blumenthal restaurant in Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park hotel in Knightsbridge, central London. Head chef Ashley Palmer-Watts then asks them to make salamugundy - a salad of chicken oysters, roasted salsify, bone marrow and horseradish - which is one of the establishment's signature dishes. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, who pick one to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the impact of Britain's colonial past on the nation's food, making a bread and butter pudding with chai and adding Indian pale ale to a sausage casserole. They also investigate the origins of gin and tonic and a brand of Worcester sauce, both of which arose from the UK's imperial past.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: Master baker Paul Hollywood shares secrets on how to create breads from all over the world, demonstrating mouthwatering recipes to transform this staple food into an array of delicious dishes. In the first episode, he explores the history and traditional flavours of great British bread and reveals how to make some of the country's favourites, including the classic white bloomer, a crusty everyday bread, a honey-glazed fruit malt loaf and the ultimate ploughman's loaf. Plus, Paul creates a medieval style rye and wholemeal trencher which serves as the centrepiece to a hearty family dinner.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: Chef James Martin embarks on a road trip along the east coast of the USA to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes. He begins by trying a classic apple pie in Virginia, before he discovers the New Orleans king cake in a southern bakery.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka.(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Now You See Me 2'

The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this sequel, illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul(n)

programme.title: UConn: The March to Madness
programme.desc: Episode 5. The Huskies secure their 24th consecutive trip to the Sweet Sixteen as the team's winning streak reaches 109 games(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

programme.title: Max
programme.desc: A military dog from Afghanistan is adopted by his late handler's grieving family in the U.S., where his close bond with the soldier's brother leads to a life-altering revelation in this family-friendly adventure from MGM and director Boaz Yakin (who penned the screenplay alongside writer Sheldon Lettich)(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: An estranged husband-and-wife treasure hunting team decide to patch up their differences when news breaks of a potentially massive haul of booty on an old shipwreck on an island off the Florida coast. However, the murderous gangster rapper who owns the isle has brought in a rival bounty hunter, forcing the pair to battle against time - and their marital difficulties - if they are to reach the golden galleon(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: Anthony Minghella's multi-Oscar-winning story of love, mystery, betrayal, honour and adventure brings together disparate plot strands, times and characters. Nurse Juliette Binoche, accompanying the Allied advance in Italy, sets up a hospital in a monastery to nurse the dying, burned and disfigured Ralph Fiennes. Seeming to have lost his memory, flashes return with the arrival of the enigmatic Willem Dafoe and his past in the Sahara as an archaeologist and his affair with married Kristin Scott Thomas are revealed. Subtitles(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Writer and director Robert Rodriguez returns to the family-friendly adventure of his Spy Kids movies with this three-dimensional action opus. Max (Cayden Boyd) is a ten-year-old boy who doesn't get along with his peers and is constantly bullied at school. But Max has an active imagination, and he has a pair of very special imaginary playmates -- Shark Boy (Taylor Lautner), a human-shark half-breed cared for by a pack of great whites, and Lava Girl (Taylor Dooley), a girl with superpowers who can conjure heat and fire at will. Max may be a creative boy, but what he doesn't know is that Shark Boy and Lava Girl really do exist, and he is recruited to help them as they do battle against Mr. Electricity, a super-villain determined to deprive children of their sleep. Shot and originally released in the 3-D format, The Adventures of Shark Boy and Lava Girl also stars David Arquette and Kristin Davis as Max's parents, and George Lopez as a schoolteacher; writer and director Rodriguez wrote the film's story in collaboration with his then seven-year-old son, Racer Rodriguez(n)

While staying at their family beach house near Seattle, the two find a box of things that look like toys, but prove to be far more mysterious. Sent back in time, the 'toys' are trying to pass on a message about the future. And the more Noah and Emma play with the objects from the box, the more their intelligence grows. But one day Noah lines up the toys and accidentally activates a powerful force that creates a state-wide blackout. With her family under arrest by the FBI, Emma must make sense of the messages Mimzy, the toy rabbit, has been telepathically communicating to her(n)

programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: In a side-splitting film that brings together some of comedy's sharpest talent, 30 Rock star Tina Fey, Amy Poehler and writer/director Michael McCullers join forces to tell the story of two women, one apartment and the nine months that will change their lives. The always winning and wry Fey portrays a focused and driven New York career woman who desperately wants a baby but is physically unable to carry the child herself. Undaunted, she recruits a South Philly working girl (Poehler) to act as her surrogate. But as he sculpted Tippi Hedren into the perfect Hitchcock blonde of his imagination, he became obsessed with the impossible dream of winning the real woman's love. programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Gets Fired. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. programme.desc: The actor meets people who share his passion for the British coast, beginning with north Devon, a 90-mile stretch of shoreline that holds fond childhood memories for him. programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor heads for London to meet the man leading the selection process for the job he wants, but has to conquer his blood phobia once and for all to secure the prestigious position. Back in Cornwall, Aunt Joan locks a mischievous schoolboy in a chicken coop - and faces the consequences when he falls ill. Drama, guest starring Nicholas Le Prevost and Gwen Taylor, with Martin Clunes and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The last-ever episode. When his colleague Hilda Pierce is targeted by an assassin outside MI5, Foyle must re-examine her top-secret role during the war. He suspects the shooting could be connected to the hunt for a traitor within the Special Operations Executive who may have been behind the deaths of nine agents in France. Meanwhile, Sam is faced with a dilemma when Adam and Glenvil crack down on the black market in East Peckham. Guest stars include Conleth Hill (Game of Thrones' Lord Varys).(n)

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: The documentary offers an insight into the daily problems facing the airport staff as they process 100,000 departing passengers every day and get their flights away on time. Dispatcher Callie and ramp manager Steve have their plans thrown into chaos when a passenger disappears after checking on to their flight. Security man Sundeep has to search an unusually dressed traveller, while paparazzi photographer Kate is on the lookout for celebrities on their way through the airport. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Cold Blood
programme.desc: Matthew Kelly stars as a serial killer who has spent his 15 years in prison playing a game of psychological cat-and-mouse with his captors. One of Britain's most notorious murderers, Brian Wicklow is vilified by the Press and despised by fellow inmates - not least because detectives have never found the body of his last victim. But then, out of the blue, he decides he wants to talk to the police. John Hannah, Jemma Redgrave and David Calder co-star.(n)

programme.title: Doctor at Large
programme.desc: Michael goes to work at a health farm, but falls foul of the sinister proprietor.(n)

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: The ladies of Paradise Lodge go looking for work to supplement their incomes - with hilarious consequences. Comedy set in a residential home, starring Peggy Mount and Pat Coombs.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Armed robbers target post offices around Aidensfield and Mason finds himself working with old flame Rachel Dawson, whose career is under threat following an affair with a senior colleague. Carol is not impressed when Rachel is spotted in a clinch with Joe, but he claims it was in the line of duty and completely innocent. Peggy offers to clean for Edward Walton (played by former Likely Lads actor Rodney Bewes), raising Oscar's suspicion she is after his money, but it is Edward's wife, now in a nursing home, who turns out to have a shady past.(n)

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Beth and Tom prepare to tie the knot, but reckon without a few last-minute hitches as Joe suddenly decides he can't be the best man and the bride worries over whether to invite her father. Meanwhile, Sally bites off more than she can chew, the green-eyed monster in Anna makes an appearance when Beth's cousin takes a shine to David and a multiple sclerosis sufferer requires assistance.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Eric Fogle is appointed as new head porter, putting Alun's nose out of joint. The hospital receives a letter of resignation from Dr Banner in Australia and has to appoint a partner to the practice - Weatherill believes she knows just the person, but Dr Ormerod favours Dr Burnett. Elsewhere, when Lucy Bayliss is involved in a horse-riding accident an X-ray reveals a more long-term problem. With Berwick Kaler and guest star Claire King.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy

programme.desc: Part one of two. Whimsical rural drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris, Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

Stan Bickle arrives in Aidensfield, bringing his daughter Josie (guest star Jenna Boyd), whose flirtatious ways steal David's heart and bring out the worst in Peggy.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A woman suffers an injury after her ice-cream parlour is vandalised, and a family feud leaves her in need of further medical attention. Guest starring Sally Ann Matthews, Rocky Marshall, Oliver Farnworth and Lisa Hogg.(n)

Detective drama, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Annette Crosbie and Jasper Britton.(n)

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Loretta takes Jodie back to the UK for her advertisement shoot, but offers Rob her swanky Hotel Beltoro room in case he gets lucky. Billy and Sheron think some role play will spice things up in the romance department, but Eddie has his eye on the room too, hoping to entice Jacqueline. Rob ends up a little worse for wear, but a chance meeting with a university mate ensures he doesn't go astray. Elsewhere, Kenneth and Liam have a falling out, Lesley and Mateo are intent on finding out what scam Sam is up to.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: A man wrecks a jewellery store and puts a security guard in hospital. Murtaugh delves deep into the psyche of the suspect, a former Navy Seal once treated for post traumatic stress disorder, and draws parallels between him and his partner Riggs, who also once served in the military. Although Riggs' association with the suspect threatens to interfere with the case, it also forces him to open up to his colleague about the experiences that have shaped him. Clayne Crawford, Damon Wayans and Dante Brown star.(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout

Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Damon Wayans, Chelsea Field, Halle Berry and Noble Willingham.(n)

Fortunately, a vacationing Poirot - who shares with most great detectives an inability to go on holiday without stumbling over a body or two - is on hand to investigate. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Ron Berglas, Georgina Sowerby and Iain Mitchell.(n)

programme.desc: Lady Hamilton wants Freddie to use his leave from the RAF to support her with the hotel and it becomes clear she wants to make changed and that Garland is in her sights. The hotel manager insists he's not worried and that he just needs to show how indispensable he is, but Peggy and Feldman aren't so sure, while Charity meets Joe and reveals her plans for revenge, but he refuses to help her, and Emma and Betsey hit the town. Drama, starring Olivia Williams, Steven Mackintosh, Jamie Blackley and Mark Benton.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: As Lord Melbourne's popularity in the house wanes, the Tories eagerly await their imminent triumph, while the Duke of Cumberland views it as a chance to prey on his niece's vulnerability and establish a co-regency with the Duchess of Kent and Conroy. Victoria is devastated when Melbourne regretfully announces he is stepping down and even more bewildered that she must ask complete stranger Sir Robert Peel to form a government, and she desperately implores Melbourne to return. Period drama, starring Jenna Colman and Rufus Sewell.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Out-of-town DI Alec Hardy investigates the mysterious death of an 11-year-old boy in an idyllic seaside community, aided by local girl DS Ellie Miller, who has her work cut out dealing with her unyielding new boss. programme.desc: Lady Prudence's society friends are rehearsing their show at Bellamy House when an air raid warning sounds, forcing everyone to shelter underground. As Richard surveys his damaged property the next day, a telegram arrives with chilling news about James.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective is ordered to take a holiday for the benefit of his health, and with Hastings and Miss Lemon in tow, reluctantly heads for the tranquillity of Devon's coast, where his relaxation is soon ruined by the discovery of a socialite's murdered body on the beach. Several people had reason for wishing Arlena Stuart dead, but high on the list of suspects are her husband, teenage son and a troubled vicar. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser, Philip Jackson and Pauline Moran star.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As the trial of local teenager Gary Bell approaches, Sidney and Geordie find themselves in disagreement regarding his guilt. Meanwhile, a man is convinced that his dead wife is haunting his home and stable yards, and implores Sidney to come to his estate and perform an exorcism for him. The vicar offers prayers and counsel, but when the man is found hanged in the exact same spot in which his wife died, Sidney and Geordie are united by a shared goal as they investigate his suicide. Drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green.(n)

programme.title: Churchill's Secret
programme.desc: Michael Gambon stars as Winston Churchill in this feature-length drama based on Jonathan Smith's novel. In 1953, a nurse (Romola Garai) is summoned to a secret location where she learns she is needed to treat the elderly prime minister, who has suffered a stroke and is not expected to survive. She bears witness as Churchill's family gather by his bedside preparing for the worst, and sees the long-buried tensions between them rising to the surface. Also starring Lindsay Duncan, Bill Paterson and Tara Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: In response to a tip-off, investigators find a dog with a chain embedded in its neck. Vets strive to reverse the damage, while the team tries to bring the owner to justice.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Officers respond to reports of cruelty involving a large snapping turtle and deal with a litter of poorly puppies.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of big game hunter Bob, who was is fooled by a predatory con-artist and put a $1,000 deposit on a non-existent Thunderbird.(n)

programme.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: The affairs of R'n'B legend Johnnie Taylor. When the musician died in May 2000 his six children expected to split his sizable estate - until three strangers came forward declaring they were also his offspring. The claims heralded a two-year legal battle.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The discovery of bones on a deserted island, which led to a couple's trial for murder - 11 years after the crime had been committed.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The case of Sandi Johnson, a loving mother with model looks, who disappeared the day of her son's fifth birthday party. Years later, her body - and killer - were found.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The story of a 28-year-old lured into a relationship by an online prankster. What unfolded was a twisted tale of how an innocent girl paid the price for another person's suffering.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Louisiana student Mickey Shunick, who went missing after a night out in May 2012. Police failed to make a breakthrough until they spoted her on surveillance footage. Eventually a registered sex offender pleaded guilty to killing the 21-year-old, and also being responsible for the death of another woman whose body had been found in September 1999.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How victims' family members and friends can assist police in their inquiries after the body of a missing person is found and identified.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The shotgun murders of John and Carolyn Tarwacki. When John Tarwacki Sr discovered the bodies of his son and daughter-in-law in February 2010, the only story told at the scene was found in the snow. Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 23-year-old Leah Roberts who vanished in March 2000 after leaving North Carolina to do some soul-searching on a cross-country trip. The Jeep in which she was travelling was found damaged and abandoned a week later 3,000 miles from her home, close to the Canadian border, with some of her personal possessions scattered around it.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Sandi Johnson, a loving mother with model looks, who disappeared the day of her son's fifth birthday party. Years later, her body - and killer - were found.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The story of a 28-year-old lured into a relationship by an online prankster. What unfolded was a twisted tale of how an innocent girl paid the price for another person's suffering.(n)

programme.title: Deadline: Crime with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: The sexual assault and murder of 18-year-old Bonnie Craig, whose body was found partially submerged in McHugh Creek, Alaska, in September 1994. The victim's mother engaged on a quest lasting almost two decades before she witnessed a man face charges in court.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The 2011 murder of Melissa White, whose body was found in her backyard. When investigators took a closer look at the neighbours, they unearthed a secret and had to work out whether it could be connected with the killing.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of University of Florida student Christian Aguilar, who vanished from his campus in September 2012. Police were stumped until CCTV footage took the case in a shocking new direction, helping lead them to the 18-year-old's body.(n)

programme.title: Dead Silent
programme.desc: The case of college sweethearts Ashley Freeman and Mike Grinnan, for whom a late-night drive to a secluded Texas hill led to a desperate fight for survival at the hands of robber Leeroy Rogers.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of a respected Kentucky businesswoman, found bludgeoned and stabbed to death in her home. Detectives followed a long path to pursue her killer.(n)

programme.title: The Detectives Club: New Orleans
programme.desc: The murder of a 42-year-old lawyer haunts Detective Jimmy Anderson for months. That is, until two teens come forward with a sinister second-hand story about murder in the first degree.(n)

programme.title: Who Killed Jane Doe
programme.desc: The case of Pamela Knight, who in 2005 vanished on her youngest son's birthday. Seven years later, two men found her remains buried under an abandoned shed. It transpired her husband, Paul Anthony Knight, had killed her and hidden her body before disappearing himself.(n)

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: How the marriage between childhood friends Alice Swanson and William Jennings Choyce soured as she slowly realised that things under the surface were as perfect as she thought.(n)

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: The murder of two Ohio teenagers. The crime tore their small town apart and remained unsolved for 25 years, until the shocking truth came to light.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Ginni Wood and her friend Kelly Gaskins who vanished in Texas during March 2007. A third person, Kelly's boyfriend Ervin Williams, also went missing. He was wanted by the police in Beaufort County, North Carolina, on several drug charges.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators in Wisconsin try to unravel the mystery of a house fire that may have been deliberately set to destroy evidence of a more heinous crime. Plus, in Florida an arsonist is linked to a series of fatal fires.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The Michigan Humane Society investigates the death of a dog, while vets try to help a duck that is losing blood.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Officers relocate an alligator and a turtle, rescue dogs from squalid conditions and tend a number of stray cats.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 25 year-old college graduate Mitrice Richardson, whose semi-decomposed body was found close by a marijuana farm in the Santa Monica mountains in August 2010, a year after she had been reported missing.(n)

programme.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: The death of spinster Sarah Hadley in January 2002 triggered the distribution of a $7million trust, largely amassed thanks to the work of her father Art, inventor of the expansion bracelet. However, as this programme recalls, her relatives feuded amongst themselves as to who should receive the money.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Report on the trial and conviction of New York Mafia boss Vincent Gigante, nicknamed the Oddfather, who was accused of ordering the deaths of seven gangsters and plotting to kill others as revenge for unsanctioned Mob murders.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The case of Californian mother-of-three Connie Hoagland, who survived a pipe bomb detonated under her car in September 2010. Her husband Larry was later arrested for the crime.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online

programme.desc: A case in which two college students were gunned down while parked in a quiet lovers' lane. Residents of the tiny community of Juliette, Georgia, were beside themselves with panic.(n)

programme.desc: The case of high-profile district attorney Ray Gricar, who went missing from his home area of Pennsylvania in April 2005. His laptop and hard drive were found destroyed in the Susquehanna River, leaving detectives wondering whether he had been murdered or gone on the run.(n)

programme.desc: The journalist investigates two cases, reflecting on how a lucky tip proved invaluable in solving the case of a career woman murdered on her daily walk and how the fate of a kidnapped California girl relied upon the help of strangers.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Carla Fuqua, who vanished after a night out with friends in October 2009. A dedicated mother, it was known that the 28-year-old would never leave her son behind. More alarmingly, Carla became the fourth missing person in a town of less than 5,000. Her remains were found three years later in a wooded area in Alabama, but eventually ker kiiller was caught.(n)

programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. programme.sub-title: Deterioration of the Fight or Flight Response

programme.desc: On Thin Ice. After a tough pregnancy, Jasmine's delivery isn't as easy as she hoped; and Briana is rushed to the hospital with severe pain. Later, Elena and Terra have not spoken to each other in over a month, but the pair go ice skating in hopes of making amends(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Brighton to secretly restore a 1984 Audi UR Quattro, which has been under a tarpaulin on a drive for 10 years. Owner Barry has dreamed of working on the vehicle, but health issues have left him sapped of energy and unable to fulfil his wish.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness instructor Tanya Manock offers up a Mediterranean-themed menu as she kicks off a week of dinner parties at her home in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, where one of her guests - medium Dean Fox - stumbles upon a plethora of lingerie in the bedroom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Food-lover Rod Tonge hosts the second dinner party in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, hoping his efforts will win him the £1,000 cash prize. However, his chances are low as he has already insulted fitness instructor Tanya Manock, and HR manager Claire Lemon does not have high hopes for his entertaining skills.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: HR manager Claire Lemon hopes to compensate for her `imperfect cooking skills' with her bubbly personality and superior hosting ability as she hosts on day three of the dinner-party challenge in Rochdale, Greater Manchester. But tension rises when Tanya barely touches the starter - or the main course.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Psychic medium Dean Fox puts his cooking skills to the test during the fourth dinner party in Rochdale, Greater Manchester. His main course goes down well with his fellow diners, but his pudding jeopardises his bid to pick up the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the last night in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, and the turn of feisty mum Sadiya Hussein to host. The tension between Sadiya and Tanya threatens to reach boiling point, and the evening takes a curious turn when Sadiya decides to put psychic medium Dean Fox's clairvoyant powers to the test.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Wiltshire residents Peter and Karen Greaves find a property for £50,000 or less on Spain's Costa Blanca.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Bedfordshire couple John and Elaine Want plan a permanent move to the Alicante region of southern Spain, and Sara Damergi takes them to view potential homes within their budget of £70,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Dungannon, Northern Ireland: Fort of the Earls.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Dungannon, Northern Ireland, to investigate a former 17th-century stronghold. Seized in 1602 by English forces, the site is now the location of an abandoned British Army base. With only one picture of the old fortress still in existence, the crew struggles to uncover the truth about this important site.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Northamptonshire to assess a Saxon skeleton discovered by surprised homeowners Morris and Pat Jones while digging a pond in their back garden. Phil Harding and the archaeological experts look for a forgotten graveyard.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend fix up a historic racing car, an Austin Healey Sprite, which has been kept in a garage since 1968. The challenge is to restore the car so that Sir Stirling Moss, who raced in the vehicle at Sebring in the USA in 1962, can get back behind the wheel.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel tries to fix a cocker spaniel's leg problems by fitting two bionic back feet, before launching a series of investigations into what is causing a cat to drag its leg. Plus, a Westie puppy with a fractured knee arrives, but it cannot keep still.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Micha and Crispin's beloved Bengal cat Loki has been hit by a car, while Faberge, an elderly Chinese crested dog with a fabulous wardrobe, is brought in by owners Julie and Suzanne after suffering seizures. Noel Fitzpatrick and the team also meet a deerhound called Willow, who has broken her neck, and with a high-risk operation to consider, her owners must decide whether to proceed.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Carpenter John Cadney's family home has been a tent for the past 16 years due to lack of funds and has decided to import an environmentally friendly four-bedroom log cabin from Finland and assemble it himself. With hundreds of pre-cut pieces of wood to fit together, his skills will be much in demand. Presented by Kevin McCloud.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott tries to help a Spanish rescue cat with a chronic eye condition, and a heartbroken young owner finds out the shocking news about her puppy.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick infuses implants with stem cells to grow bone and cartilage in two ground-breaking operations. An energetic seven-month-old Italian Spinone is brought in after scans reveal it has a hole in its shoulder bone. With regenerative medicine opening up new options, the vet offers the puppy's owner a custom-made implant to plug the hole. He also treats a seven-year-old border collie left in constant pain from a broken leg after being hit by a car five months ago. Owner Lisa is reluctant to amputate, so Noel proposes a new treatment that has never been tried before.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old motorcyclist Sam is airlifted to St George's after crashing into a bus and being thrown under a car. He is placed in an induced coma and CT scans reveal Sam has bruising to his lungs, a ruptured kidney, a broken thigh bone and a fractured spine. The priority of the medics is is to stop his internal bleeding, while Sam's parents are rushed to the hospital by police. Meanwhile, seven-year-old Raheem arrives in A&E with his dad Dennis after cutting his wrist while playing at home, and 59-year-old Therese turns up with a painful lump on her finger.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a restaurant in Mount Sinai, New York, which appears to be stuck in the 1980s. The crumbling decor and unenthusiastic head chef at the Handlebar need to be tackled, but owners Bill and Carolyn LeRoy are in denial about the problems they face.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott tries to help a Spanish rescue cat with a chronic eye condition, and a heartbroken young owner finds out the shocking news about her puppy.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old motorcyclist Sam is airlifted to St George's after crashing into a bus and being thrown under a car. He is placed in an induced coma and CT scans reveal Sam has bruising to his lungs, a ruptured kidney, a broken thigh bone and a fractured spine. The priority of the medics is is to stop his internal bleeding, while Sam's parents are rushed to the hospital by police. Meanwhile, seven-year-old Raheem arrives in A&E with his dad Dennis after cutting his wrist while playing at home, and 59-year-old Therese turns up with a painful lump on her finger.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Host Jimmy Carr is joined by team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson for a selection of best bits from the comedy panel show.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend fix up a historic racing car, an Austin Healey Sprite, which has been kept in a garage since 1968. The challenge is to restore the car so that Sir Stirling Moss, who raced in the vehicle at Sebring in the USA in 1962, can get back behind the wheel.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In north Surrey, planning enforcement officer Becky is joined by singing teacher Petrina, drum teacher Rob, solicitor Shoba and building company boss Giovanni. Becky plans to delight her guests with an evening of modern home-cooking and a menu including butternut, lamb and a deconstructed apple dessert. The week gets off to an intriguing start with young gun Rob taking a shine to Petrina and vice versa.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Solicitor Shoba hosts the second night in north Surrey, and tries to impress with an Indian-themed menu. However, the guests are less than impressed with the food, especially the main course - a curry made from frozen fish - but will a bit of belly dancing, Bollywood-style, help save the day? Meanwhile, singer Petrina and drummer Rob continue their flirting both at and away from the table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Drum tutor Rob hosts the third night in north Surrey, hoping his Thai-themed menu will impress his guests, as well as the object of his affections, Petrina. He serves prawns with lemon, lime and chilli for his starter, Thai chicken curry for his main, and rounds off with his own take on an ice-cream sundae. As a single man living in his stepmother's house, Rob thinks his competitors will see him as an underdog, so is intent on pulling out all the stops.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Singing teacher Petrina hosts the fourth dinner party in north Surrey, and she believes her experience of entertaining on cruise ships will give her the edge as she plans a showstopper of an evening. However, the diners seem more interested in their host's continued flirting with fellow guest Rob. Will tonight be the night, or will he shy away when he discovers Petrina has sung in the West End and worked with dozens of household names?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Giovanni hosts the final night of the competition in north Surrey, intent on flying the flag for Sicily with some family inspired recipes. Even with help from his father, a tagliatelle tragedy leaves him with Parmesan on his face. Becky is less than impressed with Giovanni's dishes, and matters go from bad to worse when he attempts to serve his home-made pasta. However, poor food doesn't deter a romantic Rob from popping the question to Petrina, sending shockwaves across the dining room. In a final attempt to bag the £1,000, Giovanni invites an opera singer to liven up the proceedings, but his musical initiative may prove too little to save the day.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Lincolnshire couple Peter and Diane Bates, who have long dreamt of enjoying a Mediterranean lifestyle in Spain, showing them traditional properties for under £35,000 in the province of Malaga.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: A Devon couple are in the market for a holiday home on Spain's Costa del Sol that can double as a rental investment, and examine a property in fashionable Estepona.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team hunt for the remains of a Roman villa in Somerset unexpectedly discovered by a farmer who unearthed a decorative floor underneath his pigsties. During three days of searching, they uncover a field crammed full of beautiful mosaics.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team of experts set out to uncover the facts behind a collection of human bones - some of which appear to be children's - found in a Derbyshire cave. A possibly prehistoric burial mound located near the site could hold the answers.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Northumberland to restore a real `barn find'; a 1934 Morgan F4 three-wheeler, which has been stored in a shed for more than 50 years. The vehicle was one of the most successful lightweight cars from the early days of motoring.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Pioneering veterinarian Noel Fitzpatrick plans to use groundbreaking cell technology to repair damaged cartilage in a 10-month-old golden retriever that helps a five-year-old girl cope with epilepsy. A cat arrives at the surgery with a suspected rat bite that seems to be getting bigger, and a whippet is brought in after being hit by a car - sustaining multiple pelvic fractures.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A young rabbit called Speedy has a broken leg after a fight with his female companion Rosie, and the bone is the smallest Noel Fitzpatrick has ever operated on. Ten-month-old Snoopy has been run over by a delivery van and the dog's paw cannot be saved, but the vet thinks he may be able to fix Snoopy up with a prosthetic. And a nine-month-old English bulldog called Winston is brought in as an emergency case with a mysterious paralysis.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Pat Becker decides her Georgian family house in Devon is too big for her, and plans to build a seashell-shaped home at the bottom of the garden, with concrete and polystyrene spiral walls. The architect has promised it will take only six months to construct - but a round house is never going to be a straightforward proposition. Presented by Kevin McCloud.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Med
programme.desc: Near Positano, on Italy's Amalfi coast, Charlie Luxton visits a fifties hillside villa that is a vision of modernity, and also examines a restored 17th-century house near Praiano.(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Properties
programme.desc: From Scottish castles to tiny homes in central London and even some ex-council houses, a record number of British properties are valued at £1million or more. Filmed over one of the most unpredictable years for the housing market, this documentary reveals what a seven-figure price tag actually buys across the nation and uncovers a council house millionaire.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow a 10-year-old who has severed his finger at school and a stonemason who has dropped a slab of marble on his hand. Meanwhile, a 74-year-old partially sighted woman is brought in by her neighbour after breaking her ankle in a fall, and draws the medical staff into stories of her challenging childhood.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Documentary series taking viewers inside the UK Border Agency, revealing the work that takes place behind the scenes of the immigration process. Teams at Heathrow Terminal 3, Calais, Dover and across the North West and North East of England reveal the methods and technology used to allow legitimate visitors safe passage while catching those who try to gain illegal entry to the UK.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team reopens the case of inner-city schoolteacher Laura McKinney's murder. Back in 1991 the death was attributed to a carjacking that had gone wrong, but the discovery of her car keys in an old school desk prompts a fresh look over the evidence. Kathryn Morris stars.(n)

programme.title: Stargate Atlantis

Plus, how some communities have set up their own vigilante groups to try to fight off the drug-supplying gangs.(n)

Jonathan undergoes a form of waterboarding in an experiment at Trinity College Dublin to determine if stress affects the ability to recall information, while Professor Shane O'Meara talks about the brain's reaction to torture and the psychology of fear.(n)

Experts Charles Hanson and Philip Serrell offer advice on items that could do well at auction in Dartford, Kent, with all profits going to Children in Need.(n)

programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Children in Need 2009 Special.
programme.desc: Special edition of the property makeover show, marking Children in Need 2009. Nick Knowles and the team meet a father and his four children who have spent four years living in a caravan in their garden after a succession of disasters forced them out of their one-bedroom house. The experts have two weeks to renovate the property and build an extension suitable for the whole family. There is also a look at how the charity's sponsored projects are helping a nationwide housing problem.(n)

programme.title: Billionaire's Paradise: Inside Necker Island
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes at Necker Island, one of the world's most exclusive holiday destinations, where guests can pay more than £40,000 a night and nearly 100 staff cater to just 30 clients. The Caribbean island is owned by Richard Branson and over the years he has welcomed everyone from Diana, Princess of Wales and Nelson Mandela to supermodel Kate Moss and One Direction's Harry Styles.(n)

programme.title: Inside Harley Street
programme.desc: Film-maker Vanessa Engle looks inside the hidden and exclusive world of private medicine, telling the stories of patients and doctors at clinics in central London's famous street and the surrounding area. The first programme features not only patients who are wealthy, but also others whose care is paid for by foreign governments or in some cases by charities. Interwoven with these are tales of everyday life on Harley Street, including a flower delivery service and a cycle courier delivering medical samples, as well as an interview with the director of the estate that owns almost all the property in the area and allocates leases to doctors wishing to practise here.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: In 1979, Richmond, Virginia, was hit by a series of random killings that terrified the residents of the city and surrounding regions for seven months. The police eventually arrested brothers Linwood, James and Anthony Briley and accomplice Duncan Meekins, with the two elder siblings receiving death sentences. In this programme, eyewitnesses and criminal experts analyse their motives and personalities.(n)

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Broadcasters Germaine Greer and Clive Anderson hunt for antiques in Lancashire, vying to see who can make the biggest profit at auction in Northwich, Cheshire. Experts Charlie Ross and Charles Hanson lend a hand and join them on excursions to Chetham's Library in Manchester and Helmshore Mills Textile Museum.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: In an extended edition, Nick Knowles and the team visit Lake Como in Italy to help DIY bodgers John and Kay Short, who are confined to one floor of their new home and almost sharing a bedroom with their grown-up daughter. In Tolentino, near the Adriatic coast, Brigid Calderhead comes to the rescue of Ben Craven and his heavily pregnant wife Lisa. They have managed to make most of their home habitable, but with only six weeks to go before the baby's arrival, the nursery is still not ready.(n)

programme.title: Five Star Babies: Inside the Portland Hospital
programme.desc: An exclusive glimpse inside the UK's only private maternity hospital, where women from Victoria Beckham to the Duchess of York have paid a premium for the ultimate pampered birth. This edition reveals how Portland Hospital's consultants, midwives, chefs and cleaners serve parents, including high-society `It Girl' Hui, who admits she is afraid of giving birth naturally. Scottish nurse Pat insists that she is not star struck but `baby struck' as she looks after the newborns of celebrities and royalty, and the Countess of Bradford reveals the impact of her career as a consultant on her social life.(n)

programme.title: Inside Claridge's
programme.desc: For the first time in its long history, the famously discreet luxury hotel in Mayfair, central London, opens its doors to documentary cameras, with director Jane Treays spending a year behind the scenes following staff and guests. The Melchors from California arrive for their annual two-week stay, rekindling their relationship with personal butler Michael Lynch, while energetic general manager Thomas Kochs travels to New York to drum up new business from leading US travel agents.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Psychologists and criminology experts analyse the personality of cross-dressing killer Hadden Clark. In 1986, six-year-old Michele Dorr vanished from outside her father's home, but investigators were left puzzled and unable to find her body. Years later, another victim disappeared in a crime that carried a haunting resemblance to the first. When investigators finally fingered Clark as the perpetrator of both murders, he went on to claim he was responsible for many more.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover's oldest friend tells him he saw his wife fall off a cliff to her death - but the officer's suspicious instincts come to the fore and he begins to think it was no accident. Meanwhile, Danny and Dr Shaw get trapped in a lift with a dead body.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Roma and Ronnie are shocked when a driver in Slough, Berkshire, records the highest reading they have ever seen in a breathalyser test, and Chris captures an innovative supermarket thief. programme.desc: Following the work of police officers in New Zealand, featuring behind-the-scenes access to cases and revealing new information about high profile crimes. Hosted and narrated by Detective Sergeant Rob Lemoto.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The girlfriend of a recently discharged Navy officer is kidnapped by a group of masked men in exchange for highly classified intelligence, so analyst Nell Jones joins the rest of the team in the field to get to the bottom of the case. programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.(n)

programme.desc: President Bartlet encounters the economist with whom he split the Nobel prize. Several youngsters try to persuade Toby they should have the right to vote, and Kate tries to iron out a border dispute with Canada. Martin Sheen and Richard Schiff star.(n)

programme.desc: Josh urges Santos to implement a new strategy in a bid to reverse his fortunes as he takes his campaign to California. However, when the man confesses his wrongdoings to his family and community, he compromises his chances of receiving the proper medical treatment. Meanwhile, House tries to manipulate Taub into taking a DNA test to prove he is the father of two six-month-old girls. Guest starring Jamie Bamber (Law & Order: UK).(n)

Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the city's biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: New evidence prompts Rush to reopen a 30-year-old murder investigation into the fatal shooting of a rookie officer - but her inquiries anger some older members of the force.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor treats a man convinced he has diabetes, and desperately tries to remove his ankle monitor so he can go to a boxing match in Atlantic City. Elsewhere in the hospital, a would-be entertainer is admitted with partial paralysis, but during a hunt for a bone-marrow donor, the team makes a disturbing discovery about his family. Taub is shocked when his ex-wife announces she wants to move to the other side of the country with their daughter.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: An armed robbery results in the death of a police officer and Frank vows to bring the suspect to justice. Jamie is also caught up in the conflict when he and his rookie partner are assigned to protect the suspected cop killer. Tom Selleck stars.(n)

Highlights include the cockroach wasp, busy preparing a tasty - and very live - treat for its young, the whirligig beetle, which employs a water-based radar system, and the jumping portia spider, which feeds on other arachnids.(n)

Siobhan and Emmett hit trouble when they try to transport Chayton Littlejohn to another facility and Job starts to worry about the sheriff's long-term plans after watching him bond with Deva. Drama, with Antony Starr.(n)

programme.desc: While Selina celebrates Thanksgiving, Ben and Kent are left with a lot on their plates when a Turkey Day crisis hits. Meanwhile, Tom James and VP Doyle have to give a statement on Selina's behalf, and Ben sends Dan to work for Tom. Political satire, starring Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Selina Meyer faces an important decision as the US teeters on the brink of financial meltdown. Meanwhile, Jonah returns to New Hampshire, and Catherine has major news.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Life in the Devon fishing port of Brixham. Spring is in the air, and the town is a hive of activity as skippers return their pleasure yachts to the water after winter in the dry dock, while the pressure is on for Brixham to look its best for the arrival of Princess Anne, who will officially open the new £20million fish market, and the start of the summer season.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham hosts its annual Pirate Festival, paying tribute to Devon's colourful maritime history, while fisherman Nathan sets off in search of a lucrative catch.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In the final programme, he discovers how earthquakes wreak so much havoc.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat explores the inner workings of six of the world's most powerful cities, meeting influential people and examining urban infrastructures. He begins in Mumbai, the most populous city in India, where he talks to the country's richest woman and one of the world's most popular film stars, as well as delving into the diamond trade.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat investigates how Moscow has changed since the break-up of the USSR and meets some of the city's most influential residents, including fashion designer Masha Tsigal and billionaire retail magnate Mikhail Kusnirovich. He also discovers the lingering influence of the KGB and talks to former secret service agent Anatoly Ermolin.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Rumours concerning Fidel Castro's deteriorating health cause the president to reconsider the economic sanctions that America has imposed on Cuba. CJ makes subtle enquiries into Harper's past, while Charlie is troubled by a termite problem. Drama about the US President and his aides, starring Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Bruno Gianelli advises Senator Vinick about how to ensure he is successful in the forthcoming election and get his religious views across to voters. President Bartlet devises a scheme to tackle the issue of the minimum wage. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Ron Silver.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: New evidence prompts Rush to reopen a 30-year-old murder investigation into the fatal shooting of a rookie officer - but her inquiries anger some older members of the force.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor treats a man convinced he has diabetes, and desperately tries to remove his ankle monitor so he can go to a boxing match in Atlantic City. Elsewhere in the hospital, a would-be entertainer is admitted with partial paralysis, but during a hunt for a bone-marrow donor, the team makes a disturbing discovery about his family. Taub is shocked when his ex-wife announces she wants to move to the other side of the country with their daughter.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: An armed robbery results in the death of a police officer and Frank vows to bring the suspect to justice. Tensions run high at home, however, when Erin drops the charges in her capacity as assistant DA and releases the suspect due to a lack of evidence. Jamie is also caught up in the conflict when he and his rookie partner are assigned to protect the suspected cop killer. Tom Selleck stars.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: A history of the British Isles from ancient times to the present day, featuring re-enactments of major events and historic turning points. The series begins in 58 AD and reveals how the arrival of a 10,000-strong Roman army changed England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland for ever. The programme also explores the achievements of early Britons, including the construction of Stonehenge, and explores social structures that held sway before the invasion.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing

programme.title: Cold Case

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Movie star Russell Berke is stabbed while shadowing Danny as research for his next role as a New York detective. Starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while there's no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.title: Gillette Soccer Special
programme.desc: Julian Warren introduces pre-match reports and news of all tonight's goals as they go in, while studio guests keep an eye on the big games and talking points. Plus, a classified results round-up from all of this evening's fixtures.(n)
